summary: Support for single-file workflows path in Worker configuration. Currently workflowsPath only accepts directories, but users need the ability to specify a single workflow file (e.g., ./workflows.js) instead of requiring a directory structure.
userImpact: Users cannot use simplified single-file workflow structures and must organize workflows in directories, limiting flexibility in project structure.
rootCause: The isolate-builder module requires file extensions and only supports directory-based workflow loading, not individual files.
proposedFix: Make workflowsPath flexible to accept both files and directories by adjusting module resolution logic and supporting require.resolve() patterns for both workflowsPath and interceptorModules.
workaround: Use directory-based structure with workflows in a separate directory (e.g., ./workflows/ instead of ./workflows.js)
resolutionDetails: Implementation made workflowsPath flexible to support both single files and directories through module resolution adjustments.
keyQuote: The webpack module resolver should be able to work with an absolute or relative path that resolves to a folder or file
